name: Der Wilhelmshof

reviews.text: Our stay at the Wilhelmshof was fantastic! I arrived at the hotel very early on a rainy morning, jet lagged and soggy, and the staff was kind and welcoming. We found the breakfast excellent with staff attentive to our needs (ie: coffee/tea once we sat down with our food). We stayed for 1 week and during that time the staff was helpful with directions and made us feel like old friends. The location of the hotel was perfect for our needs, and very close to the subway station.
reviews.title: GENEROUS Breakfast!

reviews.text: Our room was lovely and clean. It must have been renovated recently because everything seemed new. Our beds/blankets and pillows were very comfortable! There was no noise on the streets so everything was very peaceful.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: I was very happy staying in this hotel, from Room to Service to Breakfast all was exceeding my expectations and I felt very good staying here. As a business traveller I appreciated the free wireless connection in the room and lobby.
reviews.title: Quiet location, near train but not near attractions

likes.disliked: — no night life or food in immediate area

reviews.text: The hotel is on a very quiet street and 5-10 minutes walk from a major rail/metro/tram stop, Praterstern, with a direct train to the airport and choice of metro and trams to the cities main attractions. The station is under some construction but easy to navigate.
reviews.title: thoroughly disappointed

reviews.text: Our group had 3 double rooms and one single. We were all happy with our accommodations. They met our expectations for the price range. We arrived near midnight and the staff was agreeable. We also used the luggage storage lockers on the last day.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, would stay there again

reviews.text: We booked this hotel because it has free wireless internet and airconditioning. And these 2 things where our only real disapointment with the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The airconditioning cannot be changed so the room was too warm, and the WIFI was SO slow that we didn't bother using it. Even though my husband really needed it for work.We would rather have had the option to pay and have a decent service..
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: On the good side the room for 3 people was large and comfortable (you will need to ask for more pillows, which reception are more than happy to help with)
reviews.title: Good but a lot worse than it seems !

reviews.text: The Hotel is clean and modern and less than 5 minutes from the underground trains. It has a good selection of restaurants close by and a supermarket around the corner. The Hotels Bar is noce for a late drink .
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Fantastic Rooms

reviews.text: Be aware though... one evening my husband could not sleep with the heat so went for a brief walk and spotted some "ladies of the night " about their business in the front window of some nearby shops. Not what you would want youngsters seeing , so be careful as to where you wander.
reviews.title: Very Clean, Convenient and Friendly Staff

reviews.text: Hotel Wilhelmshof is a very good, relatively reasonably priced, and conveniently located option for Vienna. I booked "superior" rooms directly with the hotel; they were spacious and furnished in a contemorary style, with large bathrooms. The hotel appears to have been remodeled recently. Breakfast was ample. The front desk was reasonably helpful. The hotel is only about a four or five minute walk from the u-bahn station and the train station, so getting from and to the airport, and into town, is very easy. (Trains to the airport run every 30 minutes, at approximately 21 minutes after the hour and 51 minutes after the hour. Note that TWO tickets per person are required each way.) It is about a 20-25 minute walk to Stephensdom.
reviews.title: Good value, nice rooms, and convenient location

reviews.text: Our stay here was quite good. The location is quite good, just 2 stops from the centre of Vienna. Wonderful breakfast, lots to choose from. Staff was very accommodating and friendly. A great plus is that there is FREE INTERNET access availlable in the lobby. Very nice room, nice size as well.
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Directions from Westbahnhof Station to this hotel:
reviews.title: Nice position, average hotel
Hotel Review
reviews.text: From Westbahnhof Station take the underground orange line U3 until Stephansplatz. Change at Stephansplatz to the red line U1, get off at Praterstern. At Praterstern station take the Heinstrabe exit, once outside walk straight toward the building that has a sign on top which says "Camino," then walk to your right until the first street which is Kleine Stadtgitgasse, make a left and the hotel is about the 2nd or 3rd building. It is about a 4 min walk from the underground.

reviews.title: Good 3 Star Hotel
reviews.text: The rooms are average, but clean.
Stayed for five nights at this hotel and cannot fault it. The hotel was clean and quiet. The buffet breakfast was plentiful.
reviews.title: magical

reviews.text: all staff helpful. It was great that on our last day we could leave our luggage in the locker room for one euro per locker. (refundable too) It was easy to get to and from Vienna airport to the hotel on the train to the Praterstern and walk.
reviews.title: great hotel

likes.liked: — The quality of the rooms, the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Public transport in Vienna is excellent. but it is easy to walk into the city ( about fifteen minutes) Definitely would stay here again if visiting Vienna.
reviews.title: Refurbished, clean, quiet

likes.disliked: — Limited English at reception and somewhat scruffy neighbourhood [but safe]

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four days at this hotel last week and it was great. The room was very elegant and the bathroom was big. The services were all very good, and al the employees were really helpful. The only problem was with the wi-fi in the room; the connection was quite bad so i used the computers they had in the lobby at the internet points. I told them about the problem and they said that maybe it was a problem with the laptop. I doubt it, but i didn't need the internet that much (after all, i was in vacation!) so it didn't matter that much.
reviews.title: Clean hotel but too expensive

reviews.text: Also, the location is very good, right near Praterstern station (we used only the subway to get around the city). Because we wanted to avoid walking too much at night, just to keep it safe, we spent most evenings at the Prater (it is a very busy area with restaurants and open-air bars for every price range) which is also very close to the hotel.
reviews.title: bad choice

description: Der Wilhelmshof - the arthotel between the city center of Vienna and the famous PraterIn the immediate vicinity of one of the main attractions of Vienna, the Ferris wheel in Vienna's Prater, our arthotel «Der Wilhelmshof» is located in a quiet side alley.The interior of the family-run 4-star hotel impresses by its warm, artistic atmosphere, which, together with the modern technical equipment and personal service, is thoroughly tailored to the needs and the well-being of our guests. We are a special hotel, since art accompanies our guests throughout the hotel – from the elegant entrance hall through the artistically staged mezzanines up to the stylish guest rooms that are individually designed. Besides the WLAN access which is available for our hotel guests, free of charge, there is also a hotel-owned garage. Please note that Der Wilhelmshof a non- smoking hotel.Our professionalism, the comfortable and cozy atmosphere and our passion for details rank among our strengths.
